title.narrative: OUTPUT 9: QUALITY PRESCHOOL EDUCATION

description.narrative: By end 2017, enhanced capacity of key education stakeholders at national and provincial levels in UNICEF geographical priority areas to deliver and assure quality pre-school education for girls and boys aged 3-5 years, which contributes to Cross-Sectoral Early Childhood Development, Early Childhood Development, Early Learning, Education In Emergencies, Education â€“ General, Equitable Access To Quality Education, Equity â€“ Focus On Girls' And Inclusive Education, Learning And Child-Friendly Schools, Learning Outcomes. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Public Engagement, Operational Support To Programme Delivery, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By the end of 2017, improved effective coverage to quality pre-primary and primary education for girls and boys, particularly for the most disadvantaged

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: By end 2017, enhanced capacity of key education stakeholders at national and provincial levels in UNICEF geographical priorityareas to deliver and assure quality pre-school education for girls and boys aged 3-5 years

description.narrative: UNICEF, together with Government authorities, piloted a programme to foster collaborative teacher relationships between preschools and primary schools, which ensures a smooth transition of preschool children to primary school. Further, an ‘ECD model village' concept was developed and this multi-sectoral approach will be piloted in selected villages in 2018. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:31/12/2017
